subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – in the form of a [[pestle]] ({{zh-l|杵}}).

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-ref|Norman (1985)}} proposed connection with Austroasiatic; {{zh-ref|Ferlus (2013)}} noted a "[g]ood correspondence" between {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*m-ŋəːʔ}} (whence {{cog|vi|ngựa}}) and Old Chinese reconstructions like *'''m-qʰˁaʔ''' (Baxter-Sagart) and *'''ᵀs.ŋaʔ''' (Ferlus).

Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Smith (2011)}} proposed {{och-l|午|tr=ŋaaʔ}}'s cognacy with {{och-l|啎|tr=*ŋaas}} "to meet head on" and {{och-l|御|tr=*ŋraas}} "to meet in (battle)" and suggested that "the moon at its full phase opposes the sun directly in the sky, meaning *''''ŋaaʔ''' 午 is probably to be glossed, given *-ʔ , ‘facing stage’". {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} regarded {{och-l|午|tr=ŋâh}} "to go against" as a mere graphic variant of {{zh-l|啎}} and thus deemed the sense "to go against" distinct from the "earthly branch" sense.

subSections.title: Definitions
Hypernyms
subSections.text:
* {{sense|as an earthly branch}} {{zh-l|地支}}
* {{sense|as precisely noon}} {{zh-l|小時}}, {{zh-l|時候}}
